column4: HELLO...what do I need to get the kernel-sources kernel-headers for my kernel?? its not custom..just the basic one
do i need to set up the extra sites in repo?
extra repos on the site, do you mean? Nope, kernel headers are in main
yes...lol..im new to the repo concept...used to be an rpm guy....lol...how to ask properly??
just replace all thoughts of "source" with "repository" 8)
after that it's just a case of learning the different options; rpm and .debs aren't all that different, it's just the options that change.
never really loved rpms..really...certain rpm packaging..makes you friend of the find command..beacuse of where "they" think things should be installed..what a mess..no distro is the same..
my guess is the problem probably wasn't down to rpm at all itself, but more the organisation of the distribution
agreed.. ...dealt with that on MDK, and suse...a mess.
I haven't tried Mandrake since 10, but I'm a big-ish aficionado of suse; their organisation *is* quite good, really ;-)
In trying to compile some I get this error - gcc-3.4: command not found any ideas.?
just means you don't have gcc 3.4 which you're looking for
is it simply aptget install gcc or gcc-3.4?
damn! Maybe there was a --help page?
